website_summaries.verdict: Offers a contemporary design and reliable airflow for a mid-level price.
pros: Earns praise for producing excellent airflow, thanks to the 1,100 rpm
Lightweight with an attractive modern design
20-inch size doesn't take up too much space
cons: May be too loud for some

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane - for fleas maybe.
customer_reviews.text: Hurricane? Only for a flea circus. I've had 50mm computer fans blow a ton harder than this 20inch box fan. Sitting 6 feet away, I can't even feel air movement. I really don't understand why you can't find a decent inexpensive fan anymore. I remember my parents had box fans that would blow themselves over on medium, and on high would circulate air throughout the house! This thing, can't even blow paper off my counter at a few feet.
customer_reviews.author: Ian R. Baumel

customer_reviews.title: Box Fan is too loud!
customer_reviews.text: I need a fan to sleep. The 20" hurricane box fan is too loud. Even at the lowest setting it sounds like a B52. It's good quality and moves allot of air but it's rediculously loud. I would not recommend this if you use a fan to sleep. On the plus side you won't hear the neighbors dog barking lol.
customer_reviews.author: Stormbreath

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have ordered the cheaper fan
customer_reviews.text: Ordered because other reviews complained about how loud it is. Unlike everyone else I WANT it to be ridiculously loud. It however isn’t any louder than the fans you can order for only $20. Seems like good quality so far but my complaints are: No handle up top to grab and carry the fan. It’s placed weirdly in the top corner in the back... NOT easy to take apart and clean. The cheaper fans you can easily unscrew a couple places and remove the back.... this one you unscrew a couple pieces and fight for the pieces to come apart. It was a ridiculous struggle to open it up to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: THIS fan puts out some air !!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes it might be loud to some people...BUT , if your anything like me and trying to sleep , this "noise" is just right. It helps to get me to sleep and drown out unwanted noise in and around the apartment room where i sleep. Yes, it can be TOO quiet in an apartment complex especially with neighbors and every day sounds inside and outside. This fan suits me just right. And it really puts out some air !!!
customer_reviews.author: M. G. Tatum

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Potato chips. Floor fans. One, or in this order two, are not enough. This was a trial purchase for evaluation prior to a larger purchase. We need lots of fans and are looking for ones that are sturdy, relatively quiet and move a maximum amount of air. This is not one. Too noisy, we appreciate white noise but this fan exceeds the level of conversation. Too little air moved for the size of the box. You will need to be within 3 feet of the grill to feel a light breeze. Any farther away and a memory of a light wind will beat the airflow from the wrongly named "hurricane". Pass.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like never write reviews but this product is lousy
customer_reviews.text: I like never write reviews but this product is lousy.... First, no handle on top so you have to grab it..... any clumsy fashion to move with 2 hands, wondering if you'll get you finger stuck in there... then, second, low is like high...WAY too noisy. High is like a freight train.... so way you can't sleep with this in your room at night on low... Will try to find my old Lasko 20 which wasn't readily available when I had to order this one....
customer_reviews.author: Jonas Bielkevicius

customer_reviews.title: Great fan! Wish the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm confused by some of the bad ratings on here.. I have purchased multiple different types of fans, and this one stands above the rest. This is a great fan! Its sturdy, It has a place for you to tuck away the cord and the standing brackets on the bottom are really sturdy just in case you wanna put it on a table.
customer_reviews.author: M.Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great product just wish it had a different design on ...
customer_reviews.text: works well and is well made but the feet of the fan don't keep it well in the window. Not sure if that is where it is meant to go but its where I use it and has fallen out a few times, once on my head lol. Anyway the fan kept on working from all three falls and doesn't seam to mind much. Great product just wish it had a different design on the feet or unit to keep it better in a window.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Janssen

customer_reviews.title: Great for small apartment
customer_reviews.text: I now live in a tiny 950 sq ft apartment without a balcony and this really funnels a lot of air out of it. But the problem is it's really loud. If I can recommend a change is to change the location of the switch to the side, so whether you're facing outside the window or facing inside the window you'll always have easy access to the switch. And this is from an award winning UI/UX designer.
customer_reviews.author: plokivos

customer_reviews.title: Good fan - Does NOT come apart for cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I'm so frustrated by the fact that this fan doesn't come apart for easy cleaning. A dirty fan is a loud, pointless waste of electricity. After reading that it doesn't come apart; I have half-pried it open with a flat head screw driver and will now do my best to remove the dust and pet hair. What's the point of having a screw on it if it doesn't come apart?
customer_reviews.author: amorina

customer_reviews.title: Great quiet fan, good for DIY purifier
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fan. Well made, the feet pivot into and out of position easily. It operates at a nice quiet level with a smooth sound, would be good white noise. I bought it as a DIY air purifier. I strapped a combo MERV 12 / Carbon 20x20x1 filter to it reduce paint fumes, and will use it when my local particulate (air pollution) is too high. Worked well for absorbing fumes. Only downside is the filter needs to be taped to the front, covering the control. So I simply turned it to high before covering, then use plug to power. Filtrete AOR02-2PK-6E 20x20x1 MPR...
customer_reviews.author: Patrick B.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for seven months....
customer_reviews.text: Update: there is a warranty with these fans (although the site that you submit the warranty through doesn't seem to show this box fan). Will use the new one and see what happens. Within seven months, this fan started making a loud knocking noise despite nothing being visibly loose or broken on the fan. It was unusable.
customer_reviews.author: John Barbell

customer_reviews.title: Moves a lot of air
customer_reviews.text: Man, this thing blows (in a good way!). My room gets really hot in the summer and the central AC doesn't blow enough air in my room, so this greatly improves airflow. I sandwiched it between my open window, and it really moves a lot of air, even on its lowest setting. Now I wish it had an even slower setting so I could keep it on all the time.
customer_reviews.author: BlackKnight

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly noisy for being incredibly energy-efficient
customer_reviews.text: This Hurricane BOX fan is incredibly noisy especially compared to the 1997 box-fan Lasko I have. As measured by Spectroid app on Android, this fan is -51 dB @ ~182 Hz @ 2 feet away. My old Lasko is -67 dB @ 120Hz @ 2 feet away. 16 db is something like 40x more noisy! However, the Hurricane box fan is incredibly energy-efficient versus my Lasko box at nearly 40% of the Lasko's near 100 watts.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done!
customer_reviews.text: The reason for the 2 star review is as follows: When staring the fan for the first time, it made a VERY loud noise, as the blades were coming into contact with the front guard. After pushing and finagling with it for a while there was no difference. Out of frustration I hit the center of the fan with a fair amount of force. This broke a piece off, and solved my problem. The only issue is that I have NO idea where that little piece of white plastic came from. Maybe it will break down the road, maybe it won't. Who knows? Otherwise I'm satisfied, and happily using the fan.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Robillard

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 months of light use
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great for awhile (around 8 weeks). Then it just...died. Doesn't turn on at all, no power going to the motor (likely a blown capacitor on the shit motor). The worst part about the fan, is its not even serviceable. Everything is just plastic housing crimped together, so you cant even take it apart to access the motor without damn near breaking it, so I can't even repair it! Just go to walmart and get a 20$ Vlasko fan. This is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy
customer_reviews.text: As far as box fans go, I've had better and worse. I've been using this one for about 6 months. It hasn't died or had any other weird issues. It's not too loud and has decent power, but certainly not a hurricane! What I dont like is the lack of a top handle. That's annoying when you want to move it. It doesn't balance as well as you'd hope either. It fell over once and the front frame bent enough to somehow tangle the cord inside around the blade. It was a pain to fix but it's been fine since.
customer_reviews.author: Derek H.

customer_reviews.title: Great breeze, weird noise sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Very strong wind from it, which is great, but it (from the first use) intermittently makes that sound that a fan makes if a plastic bag has been sucked onto the back of a fan, but there’s no bag there. Rather annoying noise considering one reason for buying was as white noise while I sleep. Hopefully it’s just a growing pain, since I just got it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Stowe

customer_reviews.title: This fan really blows !!!
customer_reviews.text: Hurricane is a good name for it! This fan pushes a lot of air. It's not all that quiet, though. But neither are airplanes or helicopters! I swear on the high speed, if this thing had wings, it would take off! I only wish it had one more lower speed to move a little less air, and do it more quietly. But if you're looking for a fan to move a lot of air, and blow your socks off, this is the one to do it. Mark Wardner, LMT, Ft. Lauderdale, FL
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fan!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fan for the price. It’s not super quiet, but I prefer the white noise to quieter fans. Something to consider. I have only one AC window unit in my apartment and this fan helps spread the AC through my apartment. I also put it on when I sleep and the white noise puts me right out.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B

customer_reviews.title: Loud and not working properly on arrival.... but blows air well.
customer_reviews.text: It’s got a pretty good air flow to it, but the fact that I had to bend the blades back because they were hitting a plastic casing for a cover screw is quit annoying. They still hit when the blades are slow starting up and ending. And the front cover rubs the center bolt the unit has to hold the blades on. But other than the noice and the pain in the ass to bend the blades back some.... it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Roche

customer_reviews.title: Blades hit fan
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if my fan is defective, but the blades hit the somewhere on the inside of the fan when it is running and you try to move it. If it is sitting in place, there's no rubbing. Not impressed by that issue. The fan is very challenging to take apart, as it is held together by one screw and the part clip together. Surely the most difficult fan to open for cleaning. It does blow air quite well though, much better than my older traditional box fan.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: This was a great fan but I would really love a replacement. It was on today on the floor on carpet and my daughter and I were chatting and it just starting banging suddenly scared us to death. I turned it off and a fan blade was broke and fell off and was spinning in fan. Crazy this fan has been on carpet in my room since I bought it. No one else uses this and it never leave sour room. Not sure what happened but I really need a new one now. It was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: This fan is pretty noisy. The low setting is louder than both of our other fans on their high settings. Air flow is ok. The entire fan is plastic, so I expect it may become brittle and fragile with age. It does move air, so it fulfills it’s primary function.
customer_reviews.author: Sennafan

customer_reviews.title: I like this fan a lot
customer_reviews.text: I live in NYC where I can either sweat to death with the heat on or shut it off and freeze to death so this is nice to put in the window to pull in some cooler air from outside. The quality is nice and it doesn’t feel like it’s going to break
customer_reviews.author: James McCreery

customer_reviews.title: Different, innovative ....
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these back in July, 2018, and it's still working great. (I have it on right now) I like the built-in-handle and all the other "innovative" features. Feet that stay attached and rotate out of the way. The on-off speed control that's recessed on the face. In fact I like it well enough that I'm back here to buy two more of them.
customer_reviews.author: TomW

customer_reviews.title: Not made to last... Not 'Sturdy'
customer_reviews.text: Worst fan ever! Only good to return for 30 days vs standard 1 year manufacturer warranty. It fell & broke a part of the plastic inside ( fan) today. Talked to everyone & they won't replace part or product. I do not recommend this cheaply made product!
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: 5 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 20” Fan
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this fan. I’ve had three different brands including Lasco. This one is the best. Pros. Control knob in front and easy to reach. Quiet for a 20” box fan. Adjustable feet that stowaway. Popular priced.
customer_reviews.author: Burton w

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: I don't recommend. To be fair I had this fan for a year and used it somewhat regularly, but it's loud...like too loud to use while sleeping or conversing. The fan bit the dust after tipping forward while on the floor, tipping face down, but not actually falling from a surface. If you want a fan to get you buy for a month or so and dont mind a machine that sounds like a hive of angry wasps, purchase this fan. If you want a fan to endure literally falling on it's own face stay away.
customer_reviews.author: jolewis211

customer_reviews.title: The Hurricane 20-inch box fan is the perfect size to fit in our doorway to move the ...
customer_reviews.text: The Hurricane 20-inch box fan is the perfect size to fit in our doorway to move the AC from our window unit in our bedroom to the rest of our unit which can't have an AC. On it's highest setting it moves a decent amount of air for an inexpensive consumer unit. The only two improvements I would give would be a have an even slower/quieter setting as well as a longer cord. The cord is substantially shorter than the previous small circular/rotating tabletop fan we used to use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: So far so go.. fan in a box with filter.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Have 2 and had them for 2 months now. Bought them to use with a filter to help reduce indoor allergies. Working great so far. Since the a/c doesn't run much now so it doesn't filter the air.. this picks up the slack and is always running.
customer_reviews.author: Philip G

customer_reviews.title: Stick with a lasko
customer_reviews.text: Take a look at the surface area of the blades on this fan compared to a lasko. The blades on this fan are half of what some other model box fans have, which means, it has to turn faster to blow just as much air. The "low" setting on this fan is like running the lasko on "high". It's so noisy on the low setting I can't hear myself think. Going to look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Sykes

customer_reviews.title: NOISY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This fan is so very noisy....it has speeds but they all all the same...fast and noisy.....also have to be sure it is propped or it will fall over. I wish we had spent our money on something else even if we had to pay more for a quiet one.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Cooling, good white noise.
customer_reviews.text: This fan is wonderful, however I would not recommend if you are a light sleeper or don’t like white noise as even it’s lowest setting is very noisy. I personally love that about it, it drowns out all the noise from the rest of my house. It keeps my room cool and is thin enough that I can lay it up against the wall and hardly notice it or have it be in my way. Love this thing. Can’t say anything for longevity but it has been running 24 hours a day since I bought it a month ago and has no issues so far. I would purchase again once the excessive use runs it down.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Loud in the best way possible!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I read reviews about it being loud but able to sleep over. I have noisy neighbors in my apartment complex who get drunk every night literally outside my window (every poor apartment blueprint if I say so myself) and boy am I shocked that this completely drowns out their drunken man conversations at 11pm. No more sleepless nights! But does it actually work as a fan? Does it keep my bedroom cool? No not really. BUT if you need a cheap fan that lets you sleep away the women degrading comments of your drunk neighbors.... this fan is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Szuecs

customer_reviews.title: Good deal!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect box fan! I’ve had 2 of them for 4-5months now and no problems, the airflow is strong, stands up good and fits on the windowsill perfectly. If you’re looking for a quiet fan this ISN'T the fan for you. Only drawback for me is that it’s not easily taken apart for cleaning the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Burgieeee

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Great fan with thin body, using it as a window venting fan and it worked wonder.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Totally awesome !
customer_reviews.text: These fans are awesome sauce! They blow a ton of air out of the attic & they’ll even rocket launch your cold a/c through out the house! I have nothing negative to say about these fans & for $20?!!! Uh, yes please!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chelza bellza

customer_reviews.title: This box fan is extremely noisy
customer_reviews.text: The hole point of larger box fans is to increase air flow without a large noise component. This fan fails utterly on both. All speeds are extremely noisy and the CFM airflow is inadequate. Seriously, the top 2 speeds are painful to the ears! Sounds like sticking your head in an angry hornet's nest.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good typical box fan (lightweight)
customer_reviews.text: It's a box fan, what can I say? I don't love it, but I don't hate it. It's very light weight, balancing it on a window sill makes me a bit nervous because it seems like it could tip at any time. It is kind of loud on the highest setting (but, to be expected). I think I just don't really like box fans to be honest. But this one is pretty good. Haven't had any problems so far and I use it a lot (it's been about a month or so).
customer_reviews.author: Sara Pope

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a nice fan... But
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged and easy to set up, convenient cord storage and seems to be sturdy for the price but the thing is noisy, loud noisy on low. I guess they named it appropriately but I have a Cyclone brand fan that moves more air at about half the sound level.
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: Loud as hell!
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar one for years that I put in the window on hot nights to draw in the cool air (I’m a Bay Area girl dating a red head so we don’t have a lot of tolerance for heat in this house!) So, that one pooped out and I bought this one. It’s weak and loud, but better than nada. I’ll be buying something else and pawning this off on one of my kids! 🤣
customer_reviews.author: SarahKay

customer_reviews.title: lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Works like a "pinwheel," am so disappointed. Delivery was very fast. I have since purchased a better, more expensive fan. I would not recommend this fan unless you just want to move air around.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: powerful fan
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my old fan, and while it is just as noisy (nothing I can't live with), it moves more air per minute and seems prfetty sturdy. Two things I would change, one being that there is no handle, the other the control, which is on the front, rather than on top. Otherwise it's a great fan.
customer_reviews.author: Karin Kruse

customer_reviews.title: I'm probably looking for something different in a fan than most — I want a fan that has a super quiet low setting
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit, I'm probably looking for something different in a fan than most — I want a fan that has a super quiet low setting, just enough air flow to bring in the cool air from outside without being too noisy. This fan, much to my chagrin but to the pleasure of most I assume, has three settings, in reality — high, very high, blow-your-flatscreen-down-high. Again, if you don't have AC and you want a strong fan, by all means, buy this. If you just want a little help, in your window, in the Spring and Fall to move some air around, not a great fit.
customer_reviews.author: Whyami Banned

customer_reviews.title: Non stop working!
customer_reviews.text: This fan works great! It is fairly quit for the amount of air it moves. Also, I like that it's design is smooth and even the dials and cord holder are sunk in. So storage is easy, and it fits great in my window! Blowing in or out works great! Fantastic buy. Have had no problems running for a month non stop in this heat wave
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: Weird that the review specifications list remote control, which it does not have, and noise level, it's average loud but not unbearable. Only thing I can honestly say about it, If i needed another fan, this is the one I would buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Katagasm

customer_reviews.title: Best box fan for the price! No questions asked.
customer_reviews.text: Love how quiet this fan is I.didnt buy it for that but wow and it dosrnt vibrate or need to be weighted down when on full. Its really awsome. I will be purchasing this fan again when my others go out.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Schapelhouman

customer_reviews.title: Great little box fan!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to run in our garage because it is unbearable in the summer months. Very powerful fan but of course the higher speed obviously the noise level will increase as well. Been running 24/7 for well over a month now and works like a champ. Very light weight compared to the old 20 year old worn out fan it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Great box fan!
customer_reviews.text: I've found the Hurricane box fan to be of better build quality and has better air flow(for less watts = more air for less $$)than most other comparable fans in this price range. I snagged an Amazon Warehouse deal on this item and 100% satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: hew

customer_reviews.title: Quiet powerful fan
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my window to pull in cool air. Love the recessed plug and front face controls so it sits nice on window frame. Much quieter than prior fans I owned and has mulitple settings. Way cheaper than paying for air conditioning once it cools off outside.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lagace

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 weeks. turn it on 3 and it barely spins.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing happened to it, just been sitting in the corner. Turned it on one day and it just doesn't blow. I had bought two of them and the other one is still working, at least for now. Sucks it crapped out a few days after the return window closed
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay S. Boggs

customer_reviews.title: Attached legs are a big plus.
customer_reviews.text: Fan performs pretty much as other brands of this size. The plastic to metal ratio makes it more lightweight and reduces the noise level. The outstanding feature however is the attached support legs. No more broken or misplaced plastic attachable legs. Harrah!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard White

customer_reviews.title: Well made, works well but is a bit noisy.
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made and really moves the air around. But it's a bit noisy. However, it cools my room very quickly when I put it in the window which was the reason for buying a box fan in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: bboz

customer_reviews.title: Great fan for the price
customer_reviews.text: We really like these fans. Very good airflow, fairly quiet, sturdy plastic frame won't rust. Yes, we like these fans...we've bought 3 so far for our house and our camper.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: most stable and balanced fan for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best box fan for $30. Doesn't vibrate like the other ones i have and is well made. The fit and finish is much better than similarly priced fans
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: qualty
customer_reviews.text: very happy with this fan. Its fairly quit. I put a 20x20 air filter on to clean the air in my living room,works great
customer_reviews.author: bill stringert

customer_reviews.title: NOT a hurricane!
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Does not move much air, even on the highest setting. The plastic framework blocks all the airflow - this is the opposite of a hurricane. The positive reviews undoubtedly were for the product before they redesigned it to make manufacturing cheap. Caveat emptor!
customer_reviews.author: John Mclaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stand up on its own--have to lean against doorway.
customer_reviews.text: The fan itself seems okay for the price, but isn't stable to stand by itself. Would not order again. Have had this brand in the past and had feet sturdy enough to stand alone on carpet, but not this model!
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Quiet AND cool
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I do work in the garage sometimes and in the summer it's hot. I just turn this puppy on and get cool in a hurry. And the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Master of Cats

customer_reviews.title: Not loud and blows air good.
customer_reviews.text: I read that it was loud and didn't blow much air. Not sure how quiet people think a fan should be. But this fan is NOT loud. Sounds like a nice fan blowing. Love it. Also not true about not blowing much air. It moves air good. Any better and it wouldn't stand up. But you know how some of the Amazon reviews go. Always that hand full no matter what lol
customer_reviews.author: Barry Taylor

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I run it with a 20x20 filter on it 24 hours a day on the low setting. It isn't too loud and doesn't wobble. I am happy so far. Update: A number 9 filter was too restrictive. A number 7 filter with the fan on medium speed worked well. I am still happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Big Square Fan
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for inside the house but it's too loud. We instead use it outside when it's really hot and muggy.
customer_reviews.author: Lenore A. Adamec

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, and it keeps falling over. I literally need to lean it against something for it to stay up. For the amount of money I paid for it, it is not worth it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Eiigna

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: If you like a loud fan like my husband and I do, this is for you! We love it and the noise is smooth, no weird sounds. We have to have a loud fan to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: bdear

customer_reviews.title: Great for white noise
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for white noise. My wife works graveyard shifts so she sleeps during the morning/early afternoon. We have twin babies and two older kids that are just as loud as the babies. This fan drowns out any noise outside the bedroom. This was the sole purpose that I bought the fan and it surpassed all expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: This fan WORKS
customer_reviews.text: I love this fan, and am glad I got it. I know, it's a fan, but I wish it were a little quieter, but what fan is? It fits perfectly in the window and is doing the job that I purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: Diane C. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: A little too powerful
customer_reviews.text: The lowest setting is too strong/fast/loud. Sometimes, you don't need "that much fan". It can be kind of annoying. But if you need a strong fan, this wont be too much of a problem. It produces a nice "white noise" effect which can help some people sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno G

customer_reviews.title: Great fan but too loud
customer_reviews.text: Nice fan, but very loud. Hurricane is an appropriate name for how loud it is. It has 3 settings, I would like if there were slower settings. The slowest setting could blow the skirt off your legs. We use it in the window to generate air flow. We sleep through the full roar on the slowest setting, but the other settings may be too much.
customer_reviews.author: LYNN VRAHAS COLEMAN

customer_reviews.title: 1st Fan Didn't Work, 2nd Fan Did
customer_reviews.text: The original product I received did not work properly. Speed 1 worked, but speeds 2 & 3 would leave the fan off. I put in a replacement request the following day and the day after that I got the replacement fan which worked properly. If the 1st fan worked I would have left the overall at 5 star, but since they are 1 for 2 on working products they only get a 3.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: Durable, quiet. I have used it for months in my barn and it seems to work very well. Sturdy to deal with all the dirt and dust in there!
customer_reviews.author: BuysALot

customer_reviews.title: Great fan I freeze my ass off every night
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fan. It blows right on you which is more than most fans do. Most fans make a lot of noise but you never feel any wind this thing is like a Vortx it truly is a hurricane
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hovsomething

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for makeshift air filter (20x20x1 with no corner gaps!)
customer_reviews.text: Solid build quality and perfect size for a makeshift air filter for dust/hair using a 20x20x1 air filter. The other box fan I tried had large gaps in the corners because the case was slightly larger than the filter but this one fits perfectly. I recommend using as thin a filter as possible as this isn't a static pressure fan and will burn out quick if pulling through a thicker filter (MERV 13 killed my last one quick! Now using MERV 8 and air flows much easier).
customer_reviews.author: Primarch99

customer_reviews.title: Hueeicane box fan 20 inches tall
customer_reviews.text: It is replacing a very old tired fan ....that had gotten loud when in use . This fan does the job easily and on low it is not too loud . I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Peeta

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: This fan has been great so far. I use it mainly for the white noise, which is pretty loud - but in a good way. I also like the design. This is replacing the last fan I got from Amazon about a year ago that broke within a month. I hope this one lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Very loud and damaged
customer_reviews.text: When I received my fan the front had been pushed in either from the manufacturer or in shipping but every time the blades rotated they scraped across the plastic front which caused a terrible noise. Although I think it may have been good as far as cooling it was impossible to deal with the noise. Other people had complained about how cheaply it was made and I should have listened to them. It was definitely overpriced for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: MARIE C. SANCHEZ

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: don't buy this over priced garbage. it doesn't even stand on its own. it falls. i have to keep it leaned against a wall or tied up with a rope. you can get the lasko for the same price. and the lasko will tilt and stay in place. i'm going to be returning this. if this was 10$ i wouldn't complaint but for $30 it should be able to stand and not fall every 3 mins...
customer_reviews.author: franklin b.

customer_reviews.title: Lousy on Air Flow on HIGH
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace similar fan, kept in box in garage. We finally had some hot weather, took it out this last week, and the HIGH setting is so soft to barely blow the air. Do Not recommend. I want to return it.
customer_reviews.author: goWest

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane
customer_reviews.text: Warmth level? You're kidding? It's almost August and I totally depend on this fan!!! I haven't turned on my air conditioner yet!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stan Baker

customer_reviews.title: Loud and proud
customer_reviews.text: Does what I need it to do. A little loud even on the lower setting but that's what comes with having a powerful fan. I'll be adding a HEPA filter to this
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Cervantes

customer_reviews.title: First one sparked.
customer_reviews.text: The first one we ordered only lasted a week before it sparked and stopped. We now have a replacement and will see how it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Brad A. Bigam

customer_reviews.title: Came broken and Very Noisy
customer_reviews.text: Blades came damaged and clicking began right out of the package. The fan itself is also extremely loud (louder than our old, poor quality fan). We purchased this to try and replace the fan that we had that would not stop clicking. Haven’t used it since the first night it came in the mail.
customer_reviews.author: comp5330

customer_reviews.title: Not quiet but moves a lot of air
customer_reviews.text: I use a box fan like this with filtrete furnace filters to filter the air in my apartment due to allergies. This fan costs more but moves a lot more air, though not quietly.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Dependable and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I have run this fan almost every night for the past year and it hasn't quit on me yet! It's quiet on all three settings and doesn't keep me awake. The only downside is that there is no way to access the fan blades without taking the entire thing apart, so if you are using this fan in a window it will get dirty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: - Good airflow - 3 speed settings Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Good airflow - 3 speed settings Cons: - A little too loud if placed in a bedroom for comfortable sleep, although this is subject to personal opinion - Legs could be a little longer for stability. I had this fan mounted on a window sill, directing airflow outside. A gust of wind passed by and the fan blew itself backwards off the sill and hit the carpet, breaking one of the blades. $30 out the window after only a couple days of use :(
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Great Noisy Fan but YOU CANNOT clean the blades
customer_reviews.text: Great noisy fan for sleeping, which was most important to me; however, you cannot clean the blades well, as there is ONE screw and it doesn't allow for removing the grate on either side. Noise wise = A+ (until blades need cleaning); being able to maintain and clean blades = F-
customer_reviews.author: mamacat2u

customer_reviews.title: Good fan for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not terribly quiet but works for my purpose. It runs 24/7 in my basement to help with air circulation after white mold remediation. I don’t know how durable it will be running all the time, but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Southgal

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane wright name for this box fan
customer_reviews.text: Hurricane is the correct word for this product. The moment I turned the on low setting it blew like a hurricane force wind. No joke! May be a little to powerful.
customer_reviews.author: willy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fan
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't come with a remote its a little loud on high, but that's good it helps me sleep kinda like white noise.i use the fan at night instead of a/c saves a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Great for the cool weather
customer_reviews.text: I use it to draw cool air into my home when the weather cools off saving on my A/C bill. Works great and the foldaway feet make it easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: geraldflanders

customer_reviews.title: Cool and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a fabulous fan it works well and easy to move if necessary. Liked it so much I bought another one.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: When I did and turned it on I could hear the fan blades hitting something and through it I could see what looked like a control box hanging
customer_reviews.text: I got my fan a little bit ago but cause the weather cooled off until now I didn’t open it. When I did and turned it on I could hear the fan blades hitting something and through it I could see what looked like a control box hanging. Looks like the thing was never screwed down. Can’t return it so I’ll try to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Jasen Zel

customer_reviews.title: Loud and unpleasant noise when fan is running.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan for my elderly parents to use on their deck. There is a loud cracking noise when it is turned on. I cannot see anything broken inside of it but it makes the same noise until it is turned off. I’m very sad about this product. Too much trouble to return.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and light weight
customer_reviews.text: I love this fan! It’s really big but super easy to move around, I move it from the floor in my bedroom to the window at night, every day. Even on the low setting it makes substantial white noise, which I enjoy, but I know others don’t.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: A good, sturdy fan
customer_reviews.text: The fan is good and sturdy. It moves a good amount of air even on the slowest speed. I do find for me, however, it is too loud. It makes hearing my TV, which is nearby, difficult, and I need to turn the volume on the TV up.
customer_reviews.author: Jim O.

customer_reviews.title: Very noisy, even on lowest setting
customer_reviews.text: Very noisy, even on lowest setting, not easy to listen to while wathcing TV or use when going to sleep...other than that, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: ShuvlinCoal

customer_reviews.title: BEST FAN EVER!
customer_reviews.text: It drowns out noise. The controls can't get knocked off as they are recessed. Moves plenty of air. I wile buy more as gifts....that's how goo they are.
customer_reviews.author: SLSG Soccer

customer_reviews.title: Great for AirFort!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with the kids AirFort! Works perfectly and isn’t loud! Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Clifford E. Dyson

customer_reviews.title: Why do they call it a hurricane?
customer_reviews.text: We like it.,it's very powerful and the design is clever, by having controls on the face rather than the edge, where they're more difficult to get to.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Duerr

customer_reviews.title: Moves good amount of air, but is fairly noisy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this fan to use in tandem with a 20x20 furnace filter for a DIY air filter. It is definitely on the cheaper side. It's quite loud, even on the lowest setting, although it seems to move a decent amount of air. For my purposes it is working well, although I wish it were slightly more quiet. I cannot comment as to its durability as I have only had it for a couple of weeks. I do keep it running virtually 24/7, so we'll see how it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Richard t. Portune

product_meta.title: Hurricane HGC736501 Floor Fan-20 Inch, Classic Series, 3 Energy Efficient Speed Settings Compact Design, Lightweight-ETL Listed, 20-Inch, White
product_meta.description: Color:White| Size:20-Inch| Style:Classic 20" Box FanHurricane Classic 20 in Box Fan is great economical floor fan with a space saving design. This fan is ideal for home, greenhouses, garages, workshops and other areas that may need a floor fan. It has 3 speed settings. Runs at 2400 CFM and 1100 RPM. It has a 5 foot 120 volt power cord.
feature_bullets: This fan is ideal for home, greenhouses, garages, and workshops
Fan measures 20 in tall, 20 in wide by 3. 5 in deep

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,761 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
